title: UX/UI Designer (Vietnam/Bangkok)
description: We are a team of passionate software engineers, product managers, and designers that enjoy building outstanding web and mobile applications.Millions of people use our apps. We work for companies of all sizes; from 1-person startups to Fortune 500 enterprises. We take a collaborative and product development approach, creating custom software that people will love to use and solving our clients problems so that they can focus on what they do best - better.If you want to grow together, work on challenging products and enjoy using the best tools and practices, Nimble is the right place for you! We keep our recruitment process practical and straightforward.To learn more about how we work, check our handbook named Compass, Github organization, and Medium account.Want to see what we have built? Check our Dribbble and Behance accounts.Want to keep in touch with us? Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.What You Will Do You will work in a project squad with a Product Owner and a development team (2-3 developers). Work closely with the Product Owner to make sure the product vision is aligned with the clients needs and assist in design discussions with clients. Most of the client interfacing is done by the Product Owner. Design beautiful and usable world-class web and mobile applications for our clients. Create User Journeys, Workflows, and Wireframes for the product we build for our clients. Perform User Experience Research to maximize the market-fit of the product we build for our clients. Learn new tools and techniques so that you are able to adapt to the evolving needs of our clients. Collaborate with other team members to define the internal processes and initiatives to help the company accomplish its mission. Our handbook has been written by the whole team. Why Youll Love Working Here You will be proud of any product that has our name on it. We are an engineering-focused company. Both co-founders are software engineers and led the tech teams at the most prominent e-commerce powerhouses in South East Asia. We really pay attention and care about processes, high quality, and aesthetics. Strong processes. We not only believe but also really work following agile principles. Developers work on well-sized and well-defined user stories, do estimate using points and work iteratively in short sprints (1-2 weeks). Regular one-on-one reviews to constantly improve and grow. We have a clearly defined process for our developers to level up continuously not only their technical skills but also soft skills. The vast amount of learning resources (Pluralsight, Pragpub, Leanpub, (e-)books, etc.) and yearly education allowance to step up your game. Nimble Growth session to invest time in acquiring new skills, work on new technology to improve our process, and share the achievements. Private medical insurance (Liberty) from day one, company care fund and social welfare coverage. Great equipment consisting of a MacBook, large screens, and any accessory to let you work comfortably. Our equipment is renewed every 3 years. Casual work attire for everyone. Comfortable and modern office space environment in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City and Da Nang. Our office kitchen is fully stocked with drinks and snacks for the team. Visa and work permit for foreigners. If you live abroad, we provide a relocation assistance package consisting of a plane ticket allowance and up to 2 weeks of initial accommodation. 26 days of paid leaves/year (11 public holidays + 15 personal days). Sabbatical month every 3 years. Company outing every year. And many more perks! Check it out here! Job Requirements At least 3 years of professional design experience. Ability to work independently and take ownership of design projects. Master in your toolset: Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, or Photoshop. If you do not have experience in some of these tools, you must be open to learn and work on them. Constantly keeping updated with the latest design trends. Being comfortable working with engineers and product managers. Confidence in communicating in English.

title: UI/UX Designer - $5-$10/hr Full Time
description: Job Title: Full-Time UI/UX Designer - Remote (Immediate Hire)We are seeking an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our team in developing a cutting-edge video editing app. If you are someone with a creative spirit who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, wed love to hear from you.Key Responsibilities: Design an average of 7-8 brand new flows, with the ability to cover up to 10-12. By screens, we refer to flows; flows often include similar screens with minor changes like a signup screen, etc. Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in daily scrum meetings. Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences. Use Figma to create both low and high-fidelity designs. Take an active role in the design process from conception to execution. Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers. Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of experience as a UI/UX Designer. Fluent in English, enough to actively participate in daily scrums. Experience in using Figma for creating interactive prototypes and UI designs. Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate and discuss design decisions. Proven experience in managing and maintaining a design system. Ability to work effectively in a remote environment and manage time efficiently. A portfolio demonstrating user-centered design solutions with strong visual and interaction design skills. Bonus:Experience with Locofy.Ai is a plus.---We are a global team with a passion for creating innovative digital solutions. Our ideal candidate is more than just a designer - we are looking for someone with a keen eye for detail, a collaborative mindset, and a desire to push boundaries. If you‚Äôre a creative problem solver who enjoys taking initiative, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.To apply, please use the google form. Again this is an immediate hire.

title: Graphic Designer
description: In this role, you will be responsible for producing an array of graphics across multiple channels for both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary focus will be on advertising, digital media and social media, with additional focus on partnerships and business development. You will ensure the Phillies brand is represented consistently and assist in establishing a best-in-class creative foundation.Who You AreA disciplined self-starter with a passion for creative solutions who values the inherent importance of branding across a broad spectrum of mediums. You‚Äôre highly collaborative and can navigate easily between various internal stakeholders. You have a keen interest in design trends and value continuously developing your skillset. You provide and accept constructive criticism in a clear, professional manner.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesBrand Marketing & Advertising Collaborate with advertising team on the creation and execution of marketing campaign assets for use across a wide variety of static and digital channels including Phillies.com, e-mail content, outdoor displays and more. In collaboration with internal and external video partners, create assets for use across digital media channels and TV commercials. Understand the Phillies voice and audience to produce advertising content that is consistent with our brand story. Work in collaboration with the advertising & digital media staffs to ensure all creative deadlines are met in a timely fashion. Content & Digital Media Collaborate with social media content team on the ideation and creation of engaging graphics to use across all official brand channels for both organic and sponsored content. Consult with external agencies and vendors on development of seasonal and special occasion projects. In collaboration with internal and external video partners, create assets for use in short-form and full-length video projects. Help define and uphold Phillies brand standards. Qualifications Education in design or advertising 2+ years of experience in a fast-paced, deadline driven studio, agency, or media environment Experienced with both print and particularly digital design & production including out-of-home, posters, signage, and particularly social media design Experience with motion design a plus Experience with Mac based platform and an expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, AfterEffects and Premier Pro Excellent familiarity with digital, social & new media trends Sports knowledge and/or experience a plus Photography knowledge and/or ability a plus A demonstrated ability to work under strict deadlines Must be available for a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays (non-standard business hours) Must possess a valid driver‚Äôs license

title: Sr. Growth Product Designer
description: Who we arePath is a healthtech company dedicated to making mental health care work for everyone. Path takes a patient-first approach, where treatment is more accessible, personalized, and effective. With Path, it‚Äôs easy to find a high-quality therapist or psychiatric clinician who accepts insurance and is actively accepting new patients.What we‚Äôre solvingOver 65 million Americans have a treatable mental health issue ‚Äî that‚Äôs 1 in 5 people. Today it‚Äôs difficult to find a provider, and for those with complicated conditions, it‚Äôs nearly impossible to find coordinated care. We‚Äôre here to fix this.Our MissionPaths mission is to make mental healthcare work for everyone.The RoleWe are seeking a talented and versatile Sr. Product Designer with strong visual design skills to complement our Growth EPD (Engineering/Product/Design) team. Specifically we are looking for a unique Product Design candidate who trends towards Brand more than their peers. The scope for this role includes working with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Engineering, Operations, Marketing) and effectively being the primary contributor responsible for extending our brand and Growth related products.As a Sr. Growth Product Designer, your expertise will help shape the look, feel, and functionality of our products and consumer-facing website, ensuring they are aesthetically pleasing, engaging, and user-friendly.We‚Äôre looking for a designer who is excited to combine user research, prototyping, visual design, and deep customer empathy with world-class design craft to build amazing experiences for patients and providers. This is a product design focused role with an emphasis on brand identity and visual storytelling.We believe in creating a work environment where creatives are able to focus on a finite set of priorities whilst maintaining a positive work/life balance. We will actively prevent role scope creep from happening; You‚Äôll spend most of your time focused on our top 1-2 projects for Growth and we will say ‚Äúno‚Äù to everything else. We‚Äôre looking for someone who is interested and excited to be an individual contributor. The company is growing quickly so if you‚Äôre a design manager, we‚Äôd still love to talk but the expectation is that this is primarily an individual contributor role today. What Youll Be Doing Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and stakeholders, to understand project goals, user requirements, and technical constraints. Conceptualize and create user-centered designs for our products, considering user needs, business objectives, and industry best practices. Develop wireframes, prototypes, and interactive mockups to communicate design concepts and interactions effectively. Design intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces that enhance the overall user experience. Create high-quality visual assets, including icons, illustrations, and graphics, to support product features and branding. Maintain and evolve design systems and visual standards to ensure consistency across products and platforms. Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and validate design decisions. Stay up to date with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies, and share knowledge with the design team. What We‚Äôre Looking ForAn ideal candidate would be someone with the following traits: Self-managed work ethic. We are a remote company building a highly focused, low overhead team. We trust people to get work done on their own initiative. 4+ years of product design and visual design experience, ideally at a technology company. Proven experience as a Product Designer, with a strong portfolio showcasing both product and visual design projects. Excellent typography, layout, and composition skills, with a keen eye for detail. Ability to create visual assets that evoke emotion, convey a brands personality, and resonate with target audiences. Experience designing and shipping complex products at all parts of the product lifecycle, from early brainstorming to post-launch evaluation. Ability to form clear hypotheses around design decisions and lay out a path to validate them. Clear and concise written, verbal, and visual communication skills. This is especially important as a remote company. Experience with Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other best-in-class tools. Our TeamThe people of Path are what truly define our mission and determine our impact on the world. We believe in building not only a team, but a diverse community that thrives by helping each other succeed and grow and inspiring each other by taking on big challenges.For employees, Path is a 100% remote healthtech company and we‚Äôre HIRING! Were excited to bring people onto the team who are committed to raising the bar on mental health care.As Part Of Our Team, Full-Time Employees Receive The ability to work from any location within the US Competitive pay and benefits that do not change based on location 2 company-wide shutdown weeks each year to focus on self-care Paid parental leave to support you and your family Medical, dental, and vision insurance through our employer plan Access to our 401K Access to an Employer Assistance Plan (EAP) through our insurance plan The equipment you need to ensure your home office sets you up for success

title: Graphic Designer
description: Level: Mid - SeniorExperience: 3-5+ years as a designer at a B2B company.Skills: Web Design HTML Marketing Wix Graphic Design Adobe Suite WordPressTeam: Go-to marketAt AllSpice, were building the future of hardware development and collaboration. By applying best-practice software design principles to the hardware industry with revision control, design review, and automated test - think GitHub/Bitbucket for hardware. See more about what were building in our recent TechCrunch coverage:AllSpice Thinks that Hardware Developers Lack Their Own GitHub, so it is Building OneWe are doing a complete overhaul of our website and need your help! Our ideal candidate has an entrepreneurial spirit and an innate ability to turn our content into web-ready resources for prospects and existing customers.Our team works close together and is always open to new ideas - you‚Äôll play an essential role in contributing to the look and feel of the AllSpice brand.This role is full-time and 100% fully remote.Learn more about our team here: https://www.keyvalues.com/allspiceRequirements Ability to adapt to a constantly changing and fast-paced environment Team player attitude with the ability to work cross-functionally with leadership and internal stakeholders Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to thrive in ambiguity Strong knowledge of WordPress to import copy, implement layout design Rudimentary HTML knowledge Ability to follow brand style guidelines and strong understanding of graphic design best practices Passionate about tech products and marketing to the engineering community Previous full-time graphic design experience of 3-5+ years Familiarity with B2B SaaS landscape and prior design experience within this field U.S. based Competencies Curiosity to learn, create, and propose new ideas Reliable, confident, collaborative, and articulate Scrappy, motivated, positive attitude and results-oriented An excellent eye for creating compelling web content Impeccable attention to detail Deep understanding of CTA placement and lead generation objectives Translate creative briefs and ideas into visually appealing and innovative design solutions that effectively communicate key messages and engage the target audience. Stay updated on design trends, industry best practices, and emerging technologies to bring fresh ideas and innovative design approaches to projects. Incorporate feedback and utilize data-driven insights to iteratively improve designs, enhancing the visual impact and effectiveness of creative assets. Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality designs while adhering to project timelines and priorities. Duties50% - Web design Collaborating in the restructuring existing web properties (such as homepage and feature pages) from Wix into WordPress Following and contributing to a design system An initial overhaul of our brand‚Äôs Aesthetic, including internally pitching new homepage layouts - wireframes, stylistic elements, and more Managing WordPress design templates and lead capture plugins Following SEO best practices during web content creation Implementing UX & UI wireframes on WordPress site Optimize site experiences for users (SEO, site speed, etc.) Subpages (i.e. industries, features, security, newsroom, product updates) 50% - Creative 30% - Marketing assets The development of marketing assets, including: Sales enablement materials Case studies Presentations eBooks Explainer video support Printed collateral (i.e. Merchandise (i.e. client facing, employees) Tradeshow support (i.e. booth, banners) 20% - Corporate branding Contributing to and maintaining our Design system Ongoing Brand Unification EducationMinimum 4-Year bachelor‚Äôs degree in graphic design, visual communications, or a related fieldNice to haveIdeally located on the East CoastSome familiarity with HubSpot, LinkedIn, webinar platforms, and other MarTechBenefitsSupportive and smart colleagues, flexible work, opportunity to make a big impact, competitive salary & equity, health, dental, vision, generous PTO, home office stipend.To applyPlease send resume, portfolio, and a brief description of why this role / the AllSpice brand is intriguing to you and how you see yourself contributing to our team. Submit your application to: Robert@allspice.io

title: Design Coach
description: About MentoMento is a career tech company. We‚Äôre on a mission to provide people access to to the best career advice in the world, and empower them take action on it. In a world where jobs and careers are rapidly changing, were equipping people with the products, information, and support to build and maintain meaningful careers.We strive to create a fun, conscientiousness, collaborative, and supportive work environment, and are looking for several team members to join us! We are a remote-first company based in the US and Europe with over $5.5M raised from VCs including Twelve Below, M13, Slow Ventures, NextGen VP, and AngelList Quant, among others.About The RoleWe are looking for a career coach to specialize in supporting Product and Graphic Design professionals. From working with them on their daily work, to their broader career goals, you will support professionals throughout all aspects of their careers.Your day-to-day responsibilities will include: Serving as the main point of contact for our users. Providing 1:1 coaching, feedback, and support through virtual sessions as well as text, email, etc. Support professionals through group coaching and one-to-many sessions. Asynchronous feedback and review on content and materials. Working with the Mento team to improve the product and user experience Being an integral member of the coaching team ‚Äî helping enhance our coaching practices and developing materials to deliver an incredible user experience and fulfill our mission of helping people thrive in jobs that they love. Acting with kindness and respect as an ambassador and representative of the Mento community Who are you? Passionate about helping people advance in the workplace, and find and build fulfilling careers. 5+ years experience working in the tech industry in Design or a Creative position! Ideally, you have experience working as a career coach (though coaching certificates are not required!). A high EQ person with acts with empathy and can create a safe space for people. You understand that there are glorious and not so glorious aspects to any job. We are a startup and we all wear many hats! Comfortable with navigating ambiguity! Other details This is a part-time position paid hourly with performance bonus. You must have bandwidth to put minimum 5 hours per week towards Mento. We will start with a 6-month initial commitment, more is great. Remote position. Candidates are preferably US-based. üî• Apply for this role! We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We truly don‚Äôt care about your credentials! If you‚Äôre passionate about helping more people access sustainable, better paid careers, we want to hear from you.

title: Brand Design
description: Free Agency is a talent startup modernizing how people find & succeed at work. We provide concierge services and digital products to knowledge workers, mirroring Hollywood-style talent representation and management. Unlike recruiters, we‚Äôre entirely paid by and motivated by the individual candidates we work with, enabling us to focus on their career outcomes. Their success is our success.We‚Äôve started with the tech industry: through our platform, mid to C-level folks in product, engineering, design, marketing, and ops are doing incredible work at companies like Square, Drift, Roblox, Reddit, Netflix, Amazon, SpaceX, Notion, Peloton, and hundreds more. We‚Äôre backed by top-tier venture capital firms like Resolute Ventures, Bloomberg Beta, and Ludlow Ventures.About the job:Were looking to engage an incredible brand designer to help us refresh our overall brand style. This is specifically not about our logo, which we love and intend to keep, but instead about everything else related to our visual presence.The ideal designer should have significant time to dedicate to the project, as we want to be on the other side of our brand refresh on a relatively short timeframe without sacrificing quality. This is a remote role and we intend to pay hourly to enable iterative work, design feedback, and a dynamic scope.You will work with the co-founder & CEO on: Overall brand style and visual themes, including color scheme, logo usage, fonts, photography, and general treatment. Graphic direction (other designers are available to contribute), including iconography and data visualization. Visual design exploration, including web layout, one-pager + deck design, social images, and blog design. At the end of our time together, Free Agency should have an incredible brand design and style guide to use. If its of mutual interest, we will continue to engage strong designers for continued work, consulting on one-off projects, and adjacent needs (print + swag).Here are some things we care about when it comes to design: Were a consumer-facing service but with a high ticket price. Therefore, we want to be both welcoming (warm) and trustworthy (serious), which can be a hard balance to strike. Sleek comes to mind. We work with people and companies in the tech industry, including the latest + greatest startups. It is important for our design to be modern and provide a sense of zeitgeist & recency. We arent looking for very rigid design -- in other words, when it comes to our overall palette, we think its great when brands do ad campaigns or fun social graphics that stretch beyond what they use on their landing page. If Free Agency, our brand, and our intention sound intriguing, wed love to hear from you.

title: Freelance Infographic Designer
description: We are seeking a talented graphic designer to join our team on a freelance, project basis to create engaging infographics approximately every 2 weeks.Responsibilities: Conceptualize and design visually appealing infographics based on topics and data we provide Effectively communicate complex ideas, data, and processes through infographic design Design infographics optimized to be shared digitally Collaborate with team members to ensure infographics align with overall goals and brand style Deliver high quality artwork and source files by established deadlines Requirements: Portfolio demonstrating expertise in information design and visual storytelling Strong preference for digital illustration ability Ability to condense complex concepts and data into clear, captivating visuals Excellent communication skills This is an ongoing freelance opportunity. Please send portfolio with infographic examples to jessica@demand.io to apply. (The apply button will only link to our website, please email)

title: Lead Product Designer
description: About TixTrackTixTrack is re-inventing the way live entertainment companies and attractions sell tickets to their events. Our software is used by industry leaders such as The Walt Disney Company, Cirque du Soleil, Meow Wolf and The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. Through our platforms, we‚Äôll sell over $1 billion dollars in tickets in 2022. Our products have been driving tremendous growth for our customers sales and, as a result, TixTrack is now experiencing our fastest growth ever. We‚Äôre looking for a great Lead Designer to help continue our success!The PositionThis is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing tech company as the lead designer for our live entertainment ticketing system. You will help transform the ticketing industry by designing a ticket buying process that both increases sales and is pleasant for ticket buyers. In this role you will collaborate with founders, product managers, engineers and customers to design simple, user-friendly and beautiful designs for all things TixTrack including the UI for our web-based software.Requirements Experience creating highly intuitive and beautiful user interfaces across a variety of environments (web apps, dashboards, e-commerce, mobile etc.) Introduce UI patterns and best practices which ultimately define TixTrack‚Äôs visual language. A passion for solving complex problems while owning all aspects of the design (user experience, visual & interaction design). Excellent design skills using tools like Figma. Experience designing re-usable web component libraries for front end frameworks like React, Vue or Angular. Keen understanding of color theory, web typography, and user psychology. An online portfolio with an outstanding body of work that demonstrates experience designing intuitive web-based interfaces. Other nice to haves: Ability to code HTML/CSS/SASS/LESS. Experience designing for e-commerce, enterprise software or mobile apps. QualificationsA bachelors degree in a design-related discipline such as graphic design, human-computer interaction or communications is preferred.Benefits and Work EnvironmentThis is a remote position in a remote-first company. Although we are serious about success, we strive for a fun and friendly work environment where everyone enjoys their job. TixTrack is a young company, but unlike many companies of our size, we are already profitable. Competitive salary and equity opportunities. Full healthcare benefits (Medical PPO, Dental, Vision). Generous paid vacation and holidays. 401K.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer (Remote)
description: üöÄWhats the position?This is a Full-time UI/UX Designer position at Neybox for talented people who want to make a positive impact on the well-being of individuals worldwide.üí´What will I be working on?We have two apps: Pillow, a sleep-tracking app, and Today, which is a quantified-self wellness app. Both apps have won an Editors Choice distinction and have been featured multiple times in press and media. They have millions of users worldwide and a great roadmap ahead.ü§π‚ÄçWhat will be my role and responsibilities? Designing new features for our apps Redesigning existing features and functionality Maintaining and expanding our design systems Usability research Preparing animation prototypes, user flows and other accompanying material for each design iteration. Collaborating with team members (developers, designers, marketers etc.) as necessary. Being an awesome team member, helping and supporting your team members when they need you. üôÇ üåç Can I work remotely?Of course! Our team is 100% remote. We have flexible working hours, but a good overlap between our time zones is required and we do encourage normal working hours.üôå What is it like working at Neybox?Our team is small (6-8 people) but its growing. We work closely together every day (Mon-Fri). For coordination, we mainly use Slack and we keep meetings at a minimum. Theres no middle management to get in the way, and youll have direct access to all people responsible for the future of both apps.üíº What are the requirements? 3+ years of experience designing mobile applications primarily A strong portfolio demonstrating your involvement and contribution in various parts of the design process of real mobile apps. Bachelors degree in Design or a related field, or equivalent experience Proficient in Figma for UI design and prototyping Strong graphic design skills Excellent knowledge of prototyping and preparing user flows Proficient use of the English language. Good copywriting skills. Proficient in usage of MacOS and iOS References from previous employers in written or spoken form may be required. ‚ö°Ô∏è Bonus skills Illustration skills 3D design (Cinema 4d, Blender, 3DS Max), Motion Graphics and video editing (Premier Pro, After Effects) skills üòå Why youll love working at Neybox Designing award-winning apps helping millions of users world-wide live a better life. Collaborating with talented individuals that love what they do. Being part of a growing multi-cultural team that values and supports each member. Access to many learning resources and sponsored learning opportunities. Great salary with bonuses. A flexible working schedule. 24+ days of paid leave + public holidays. And more! üì• Great! How can I apply?Just hit the button Apply for this position button below! Please note that this is the only acceptable way to apply. All other ways of contacting Neybox about the position, will be rejected.

title: Designer
description: Company Description Mechanism is an early-stage venture firm that partners with entrepreneurs to launch and scale ambitious companies. In our model, we work to identify and validate opportunities before creating every business. We then provide the growth expertise to gain early traction as well as the business support to establish positive unit economics, profitability, and scale. In addition to investment and strategic guidance, we offer extensive operational support for our startups in critical areas, including Growth, Product, Design, Operations, People, Finance, and Legal. Our in-house experts are at the top of their fields and are here to provide world-class support and expertise helping our startups get off the ground and scale.As a team, we have deep expertise across growth marketing, and it‚Äôs an important part of our company-wide culture. When it comes to launching and scaling companies, we don‚Äôt guess. We engineer.Our success rate of getting companies profitable is 100%, and our team has a track record of investing in and cofounding multiple companies with $100M+ revenue.Position DescriptionWe are seeking a talented and experienced freelance designer with a strong focus on revenue growth, branding, and marketing design. In this role, you will be responsible for creating visually stunning and user-friendly digital touchpoints that drive conversions and support our growth marketing initiatives. Your expertise in both design principles, branding, and marketing strategies will be essential in elevating our portfolio companies‚Äô online presence and maximizing revenue opportunities. You‚Äôll work closely with our product team and our portfolio companies‚Äô internal teams. If you are passionate about creating impactful designs that attract and engage users, while optimizing for business growth, we would love to have you on our team.What Youll Do Learn about our portfolio companies markets and their user demographics: Gain a deep understanding of the markets in which our portfolio companies operate and familiarize yourself with the unique characteristics and preferences of their target audiences. This knowledge will help you create designs that effectively resonate with and engage their specific user demographics. Bring portfolio companies brands, platforms, and websites (marketing and e-commerce) to the next level: Elevate the visual identity and user experience of our portfolio companies brands and websites. Collaborate with the growth marketing teams to develop design strategies that align with their overall goals and enhance brand recognition, while ensuring a cohesive and seamless user experience across all touchpoints. Create landing pages, user acquisition flows, and SEO pages: Design compelling landing pages and user surveys and quizzes that drive conversions and capture leads. Utilize your understanding of SEO best practices to optimize the website pages for search engine visibility and improve organic traffic. Ensure that the landing pages and SEO pages are visually appealing, user-friendly, and aligned with the marketing objectives of the portfolio companies. Collaborate with the portfolio companies‚Äô CEOs and product teams to conduct A/B testing of different design solutions. Use data-driven insights to evaluate the performance of various designs, iterate on them, and refine the user experience. By continuously experimenting and optimizing, you will contribute to improving conversion rates and overall user engagement. Conduct usability tests to gather feedback on the usability and intuitiveness of website designs. Conduct user interviews to gain insights into user behavior, preferences, and pain points. Apply the insights gathered from these activities to refine and enhance the user experience, ensuring that the designs effectively meet the needs and expectations of the target audience. Leverage AI and tools to support your design and research efforts. This may include using AI-powered analytics tools to gain insights from user data, utilizing AI-driven design tools to automate repetitive tasks, or employing AI-based algorithms to personalize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging AI trends and incorporate them into your design process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Who You Are You are humble. You operate with intellectual honesty and check our egos at the door. You are receptive, adaptable, and we help each other succeed. You are fast. You optimize for speed of learning, execution, and growth. You do not get blocked easily. You are data-driven. You trust data over intuition. You don‚Äôt guess. You engineer. You are an overachiever. You partner with CEOs as cofounders and go all in. You know start-up life is not 9-5 and that excites you. You drive your own accountability and take pride in doing great work. A win for a portfolio company is a win for Mechanism. You play the long game. You do the things today that will help us tomorrow. You optimize for the long-term enterprise value (EV) of Mechanism portfolio companies and know significant companies take years to build. You are passionate. You actively promote a positive, high-energy culture of high performance, connection, and trust. You believe life is short, so you enjoy it and do what you love. What Youll Bring Proven experience as a Growth Designer, preferably in a revenue-focused or marketing-driven environment. Experience with Google Analytics and design tools such as Figma, Adobe CS, and FullStory. Strong understanding of UX/UI principles and ability to create visually appealing, user-friendly designs that align with marketing goals. Knowledge of responsive design principles and experience in designing websites for optimal performance across various devices and screen sizes. Solid understanding of SEO principles and best practices and the ability to implement SEO strategies into website designs. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, content, and development teams. Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset to evaluate the effectiveness of designs and make data-informed optimizations. Ability to context switch effectively and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A keen eye for detail and a passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging design techniques. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, with the ability to collaborate effectively with developers for seamless implementation. Location and Time CommitmentWe are fully remote - you can work wherever you‚Äôre most productive. This role is freelance, and meetings will need to overlap with US EST.

title: Graphic (Marketing) Designer
description: To apply please submit your portfolio and a brief cover letter explaining why you are interested to creative@ispot.tv.IntroductionWe are seeking a highly creative and talented Visual Designer to assist our marketing team. As a Visual Designer, you will play a crucial role in shaping our brand identity and creating visually compelling marketing materials to support our business objectives.Responsibilities Design engaging and impactful marketing materials, including report covers, social graphics, web pages, one sheets, white papers, and other visual marketing assets. Develop and maintain a consistent brand image across all marketing materials. Generate fresh ideas and innovative design concepts that align with our brand guidelines. Ensure designs are optimized for various channels and platforms, including digital and print. Conduct design reviews and incorporate feedback to refine designs. Requirements Proven work experience as a Visual Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your creative skills. Proficiency in industry-standard design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Knowledge of Canva is a plus. Solid understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout composition. Experience designing marketing materials for digital and print mediums with strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively present and explain design concepts. Candidates regularly available during US working hours will be given priority.

title: Senior Designer
description: Harley & Co. is an award-winning, internationally recognized creative and entertainment studio that specializes in media properties, experiences, identity design and narrative content. We work at the crossroads of audio/video series, campaigns, physical installations and graphic design. We are looking for a senior designer who is creative, talented with an eye for typography, design and layout. The senior designer should be someone who loves to use design to tell complex stories that shift culture. They should have a passion for film, photography, typography and contemporary ways to apply graphic design. They should believe that design, if used well, can be a transformative tool for change. This job requires someone who is endlessly curious and loves learning new things. You should bring proficient skills within the Adobe Suite (Photoshop and Illustrator, InDesign required) C4D and after effect knowledge is a plus as you will be creating design assets across multiple platforms. The company currently operates on a remote basis with all employees and has a centrally located headquarters in New York City. Responsibilities: ¬∑ Easily adapt and add to our company philosophy ‚Äì think differently, constantly evolve/elevate your work, inspire the team, and lead by example getting hands on with the work¬∑ Come from a mindset of earning your spot. Developing big ideas within practical considerations that connect to culture.¬∑ Collaborate with our Creative Director and Senior Art Director to execute brand vision for our clients¬∑ Have strong understanding of how to shape narratives, and an appreciation for strategic thinking¬∑ Get into the details, review & refine briefs, understand project plans & staffing, and be constantly thinking about how to set the team up for success What You Bring:‚óè Bachelor Degree in Design, minimum 5-7 years of experience‚óè Comfort working across discipline‚óè Proficiency in Adobe Suite - Photoshop and Illustrator required - InDesign, and After Effects a plus.‚óè Print experience with strong typography and layout skills‚óè Ability to take feedback and learn from experts in the field of design and creative thinking What We Value:‚óè Compassion: Empathy for the people our work supports and our colleagues‚óè Curiosity: A continuous ambition to learn and apply new knowledge/techniques cross platforms‚óè Adaptability: Ability to wear multiple hats and working outside of your comfort zone‚óè Composure & Poise: A level-minded demeanor through client feedback and fast working conditions

title: UX / UI Digital Product Designer
description: Job Description: Junior to Mid UX UI Digital Product Designer at OCTO-EULocation: Lyon, France (Headquarters based in Providence RI, USA)About OCTO and the role:OCTO Product Development is a nimble research, product and software development group built on the idea that high quality design work comes from the combination of experience, intuition, and an engaging workplace to support innovation.As a small but growing firm, we offer a unique opportunity for a junior to mid UX/UI designer to take on diverse projects and responsibilities. At OCTO, we embrace a non-corporate environment where creativity knows no bounds. We value creativity and believe design thinking is not just something for designers.Our primary focus is on industrial tech and manufacturing tech clients, as well as med tech, green tech, blue tech, and energy tech, serving clients worldwide, but primarily in the US and Europe. As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with clients and our internal senior members, integrating seamlessly to help us deliver outstanding project results. We encourage self-starters who are comfortable with flexibility, turning projects around on tight deadlines, and enjoy working in an environment that encourages a balance between work and hobbies. Collaborating with our team members who come from a diverse range of career backgrounds and our wide range of client types makes OCTO a great place to test the waters in many industries and stay in the know of cutting-edge of tech advancements.Responsibilities: Being a master of Figma. This is our main production tool for building full spec product as well as releasing clickable prototypes. Expect to keep apprised of software features and updates to utilize best functionality, we love to hear about new plug-ins and shortcuts! Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clients, to define and develop compelling user experiences, concepts, and strategies for softwares and apps, saas products, workshops, and events / expos experiences etc. Develop user flows, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively communicate design concepts and interactions. Help to conduct product research, user testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and ensure optimal user experiences. Collaborate with our internal team to create visually stunning and intuitive user experience and interfaces that align with our clients brand identities and project goals. Contribute to build and maintain design libraries and component libraries in Figma to facilitate collaboration and ensure design consistency. Track and manage design tasks and projects using agile project management tools such as Jira or Notion and slack + client communication networks. Utilize design softwares such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Lightroom, After Effects etc, and keynote + powerpoint to create captivating visuals and presentations as needed. Foster strong client relationships and confidently present design concepts to client groups and stakeholders. Demonstrate a solid knowledge base of front-end coding functionality to collaborate effectively with developers. Requirements: A portfolio and resume showcasing your outstanding visual storytelling skills and expertise in UX/UI design. Proven experience and strong skills in user experience design, user interface design, user flows, product architecture and wireframes, persona building and user research. Proficiency in Figma for creating screens, prototypes, and libraries. Familiarity with collaborative project mapping / brainstorming tools like Miro / Figjam etc. Fluency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Keynote, and PowerPoint. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with remote and local teams. Experience in client relations and confidently presenting design concepts to stakeholders and to internal teams. Solid understanding of frontend coding functionality. A flexible mindset with the ability to adapt to ever evolving project requirements and to fill in various roles. Fluent English is a must, bonus if you speak French or other languages! Bonus skills and nice to haves we love: Print graphic production knowledge. Drawing and illustration skills. Basic motion graphics / animation / video editing skills in After effects, Premier pro, Cinema 4d, etc. a plus Coding skills are great if you like to occasionally help build UI or do QA with out resident head of dev. Past experiences designing for physical space and or convention / expos etc. and on the ground event collaboration. Experience working in XR (Extended Reality), AR (Augmented Reality), VR (Virtual Reality) experience design as we are extending our work in this field. Bonus for working in game engines such as Unity etc. Experience in 3D design with Blender, 3ds max, Cinema 4d etc., Zbrush or keyshot, Solidworks. We do a lot of physical work as well and for XR. Social media skills (we admit we are not the best at this, but were getting there). Join OCTO-EU:If you are a talented and versatile junior to mid UX/UI designer looking for a challenging and creative environment, OCTO offers an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects in various industries. We value your unique perspective and encourage you to bring your creativity and problem-solving skills to our team. Apply now!Send us your portfolio and resume to check out at jobs@octopd.com

title: Graphics Designer/Social Media Coord
description: Graphics Designer/Social Media CoordinatorThe Environmental Integrity Project (EIP) is seeking a graphic artist with strong social media and layout skills to improve the visual presentation and communication power of our reports, social media channels, websites, brochures, fund-raising materials and branding. The successful candidate should be skilled and experienced in creating layouts for long reports ‚Äì both in PDF form and online -- with creativity, clarity, visual brilliance, compelling photos, and accurate presentations of data and maps. The candidate should also be adept at conceiving and creating infographics, short videos, digital illustrations, and frequent written content for social media to inform readers and attract more social media followers. The Graphics Designer and Social Media Coordinator will have the responsibility of conceiving, sharpening, upgrading, and unifying EIP‚Äôs visual presentations ‚Äì including our logos and reports, web pages, fact sheets, fund-raising materials, E-newsletters and blogs. And the coordinator will be tasked with writing and creating content every week for EIP‚Äôs social media channels and expanding the reach of those channels.Qualifications: Candidates should have extensive knowledge of and skills in software to produce illustrations in both digital and PDF form, as well as short videos. These could include (but not limited to) Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, Flourish, Webflow, and Photoshop. At least five years of experience of relevant work experience and a college degree are preferred. Applicants should also have a passion for the environment and should be able to manage multiple tasks at once and work well with others.Compensation: Salary will be competitive for a full-time graphics designer and social media coordinator in the Washington DC metro area, but also based in part on experience. The salary range is from $62,000 to $88,000.Location: The employee will work mostly remotely, like most EIP employees. EIP is based in Washington, D.C., and some employees choose to work a few days a week at our offices at 1000 Vermont Avenue NW in Washington DC. But this is not a requirement.Equal Opportunity: EIP is an equal opportunity employer, highly values diversity, and strives to create an inclusive workplace culture. As an equal opportunity employer, EIP is committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are provided with equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or any other factor that is not related to the position. To Apply: Candidates should send a cover letter, resume, five samples of their graphics illustration or report layout work, and three examples of their social media illustrations. Email the materials to Tom Pelton, Director of Communications, Environmental Integrity Project, tpelton@environmentalintegrity.org and hr@environmentalintegrity.org with the subject line ‚ÄúApplication for EIP Graphics Designer/ Social Media Coordinator.‚Äù The letter must include a description of the candidate‚Äôs experience with and knowledge of social media.

title: Web Designer
description: Studio III Marketing is a full service marketing agency with offices in Los Angeles, Austin and Tampa Bay. At Studio III, we see graphic design as visual storytelling that engages, informs, and inspires. We are looking for a highly creative Graphic Designer who can take conceptual ideas and create visual representations, primarily for websites.We are seeking a skilled individual to join our team as a Web Designer with expertise in Figma. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting and diverse projects that will challenge your creativity and expertise. Whether you prefer the flexibility of freelancing or the stability of a full-time position, we welcome your application.Responsibilities: Collaborate with the design and development team to understand project requirements and objectives. Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using Figma, ensuring design concepts are visually appealing and align with client expectations. Utilize Figmas collaboration and version control features to streamline design processes and maintain design consistency. Incorporate user-centered design principles to create intuitive and engaging interfaces. Stay up to date with the latest web design trends, techniques, and best practices. Iterate on designs based on feedback received from stakeholders, clients, and users. Work closely with front-end developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs. Requirements: Proven experience as a Web Designer with an impressive portfolio showcasing your design skills and expertise in various design tools and software. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, information architecture, and usability best practices. Ability to adhere to reasonable deadlines. Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, emerging technologies, and design techniques. If interested, send your resume and a link to your portfolio to Hiring@studio3marketing.com. Please include your freelance rate and/or salary expectations.

title: Contract Web Designer (Remote)
description: Contract OpportunityRate: $50 - $70 hourlyThe Gnar Company is a fast-growing software consulting company seeking a Contract Web Designer to work with our Director of Design on a contract-to-hire basis. Youll be responsible for creating outstanding user experiences for our clients gnarly software problems. You will work alongside cross-functional teams, which include engineers, product managers, and other designers, to produce designs that meet business objectives and are user-centered.Responsibilities: Conceptualize and implement creative ideas for client websites, as well as creating visual elements that are in line with clients branding. Develop wireframes, prototypes, personas, and user journeys Understand and create sitemaps to visualize the structure of a website. Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and the director of design to develop design solutions and concepts that cater to user needs and achieve business objectives. Prepare design plans and present the website structure Incorporate functionalities and features into websites Develop and maintain design standards and guidelines, ensuring consistency across all devices. Conduct user research, usability testing, and analysis to inform design decisions and optimize user experiences. Stay up-to-date with emerging design trends, tools, and technologies Help plan and conduct client discovery sessions Communicate and present design solutions to the client Requirements 5+ years of design experience (Experience working on complex applications are a plus) Experience responsive designing marketing and ecommerce websites Strong people skills, especially collaborating with clients Deep understanding of UX principles Comfortable working in a wide range of industries, clients, and project sizes Experience collaborating with a team, especially in a remote office environment Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and determine a plan that will ensure they are met or exceeded General design curiosity and a passion for making great things Experience with Figma and prototyping Basic understanding of modern web technologies, browsers, frameworks, and devices Excellent visual design skills Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues General understanding of modern productivity tools (Slack, email, Google Docs, etc) An online portfolio Based in the United States (Sorry, no sponsored visas) About The Gnar Company We help companies solve gnarly software problems. From small, one-person startups to enterprises, we help businesses level up their teams, hone in on their process, and ship the right features at the right time. You will be joining an experienced team, and will be instrumental in crafting our company culture and team values. We are growing quickly and this role presents an excellent opportunity to grow with us. We value a strong work/life balance, when you are off work it‚Äôs your time.Based in the United States (Sorry, no sponsored visas)

title: Senior Product Designer
description: About RemoteRemote is solving global remote organizations‚Äô biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how-it-works to learn more or if you‚Äôre interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.Please take a look at remote.com/handbook to learn more about our culture and what it is like to work here. Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. You can check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor or look up the results of our candidate surveys to see how others feel about working and interviewing here.All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!What this job can offer you Take ownership of strategic design and user-experience decisions, and pioneer new functions and features that solve our user‚Äôs problems. Join a close knit group working on the Fintech space in our Payments team, serving a critical part of the product for our customers. Work in a user-centered way, to discover, define, rapidly test and iterate your designs. Work in cross-collaborative teams with product and engineering to implement new features and iteration - learning rapidly from seeing your work in the real world. Join a supportive design practice where you will help further increase the design team‚Äôs level of ux maturity. What you bring An advanced level of product design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments, fintech or HR tech experience is a big plus for this position. An impressive portfolio showcasing a clear understanding of simplicity, typography, interaction design and UI design Proven experience of advocacy for the customer and applying UX methodologies including user research and insights to your design. An understanding and appreciation of the practice of design iteration - you will always be experimenting, evaluating and learning. A systematic approach to creating and maintaining our design system Practicals Youll report to: Product Design Manager Team: Design Location: APAC / Americas by preference Start date: As soon as possible Remote Compensation PhilosophyRemotes Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.For U.S. applicants: Across all US locations, the base salary range for this full-time position is $98,000 to $122,000 plus eligibility for equity. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.We offer a generous benefits package to all full-time employees. Currently in the U.S. this includes: 401(k) plan + employer match, flexible paid time off, paid sick leave in excess of local requirements, parental leave, FSA, HSA, health, dental and vision plans. Click here for more information on our global employee benefits.Application process Interview with recruiter Interview with future manager Interview with team member Second interview team member (optional) Interview with executive (optional) Prior employment verification check (Read more at remote.com/employment-checks) BenefitsOur full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits are for all Remoters: unlimited personal time off (minimum 4 weeks) flexible working hours (we are async) 16 weeks paid parental leave mental health support services stock options learning budget home office budget & IT equipment How you‚Äôll plan your day (and life)We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

title: Design Manager / Lead Graphic Designer
description: 2 Towns is looking for a seasoned Design Manager / Lead Graphic Designer who will provide design leadership and expertise for our team. The successful candidate will help guide the visual identity of our brands, create compelling package designs for our products, and will oversee all design projects from concept to completion.This role consists of two important graphic design roles in the Marketing department; Design Manager and Lead Graphic Designer.The Design Manager function of the role will lead the design process from planning and prioritizing design projects with stakeholders throughout the company to organizing, assigning and carrying out day-to-day design work. The Design Manager works with a team of internal & external designers to effectively and consistently execute projects on time and at a high caliber that maintains and follows a consistent brand strategy and aesthetic.The Lead Graphic Designer function of the role will utilize their graphic design skills to create and/or contribute toward design work wherever most appropriate and effective in executing the highest quality deliverable possible. Provide relevant direct management supervision to internal Graphic Designers and direct guidance to the external Graphic Designer team.2 Towns Ciderhouse aspires to create craft beverages that are accessible to the people, utilizing the most advanced production standards, and quality Northwest ingredients, without being afraid to do things a little differently. Much like our product, 2 Towns as a company is fun, unique, and filled with energy. Our crew is what makes what we do possible, and we are committed to fostering an environment of fairness, empowerment, and security.Our ideal candidate will have a mastery of design principles, as well as a strong understanding of business and marketing concepts, which will be intentionally and thoughtfully woven together, with the ability to explain and justify their recommendations to stakeholders. Experience working both as an individual and leading teams to generate graphics for print medium as well as for screen.After six months, you‚Äôll know you were successful if: You have developed a deep understanding of our company, processes, and family of brands and have begun to leverage your design expertise to lead our design processes and continue to build and polish our brand image through design. Design timelines are being executed more reliably ahead of schedule, and our packaging and brand collateral are noticeably improving in brand consistency, impactfulness, and effectiveness. If this opportunity ignites your passion for design and you‚Äôre excited to help grow and evolve our family of brands, we encourage you to apply!Required Minimum Qualifications: 21 years or older Education: College degree in graphic design or related field Experience: 8 years in a similar or related field Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite (especially Illustrator, Photoshop, In-Design, Acrobat) Familiarity with PMS color management for off-set press printing Experience designing marketing materials / graphics for business, consumer goods, or commercial packaging Experience working with a team to create project deliverables Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Business Apps (Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Docs, etc.) Compensation & Benefits:2 Towns Ciderhouse offers competitive wages that will be determined by experience and may include health insurance, monthly merchandise credit, 401k & profit sharing/bonus opportunities, and paid time off. Benefit eligibility is dependent on job classification and hours worked. Salary Range: $65k - $80k Annually (Compensation will be based on the experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant) Schedule: Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 5:00 pm (Hybrid availability after initial training period)

title: UI Designer
description: We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer from Mexico, Guadalajara - or remote in Mexico who will be responsible for the user interface (UI) design of our various contact data related products. The UI has similarities to CRM tools, but is focused on surfacing marketing and sales contact and company data as well as other attributes supporting the marketing and sales teams.You will ensure in your deaign that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design working with the front end developers and our business and product owners.The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering visually useful designs by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends.UI UX Designer Responsibilities: gathering the user experience design requirements from our product owners. Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes. Designing all UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, tabs, and widgets for our digital assets. Adhering to style standards on typography and graphic design. UI UX Designer Requirements: A bachelors degree and a minimum of 2 years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services. A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms. Proficient in Figma, Adobe Creative and other UI design tools A team player but can work independently too. Apply on Behance

title: Senior Motion Designer
description: About UsOur lively digital advertising agency is seeking an experienced and talented motion designer to join our creative team! This person will help create short- to mid-length videos as part of our post-production workflows, as well as design other creative for digital and traditional advertising campaigns for our progressive political and responsible corporate clients. Responsibilities:Have a great attitude, a willingness to learn, and to work hardCollaborate with the creative and strategy teams to brainstorm, conceptualize, and execute impactful, client-ready advertising creative, often on tight deadlines Work on every phase of the production workflow from scripts, style frames and storyboards, color-correcting selects and stringouts from raw footage, to rough and final cuts Assist in the day-to-day organization, logging, and media management of new content Design motion graphics including kinetic typography, animation, and data visualizations Translate scripts/storyboards/creative direction into engaging, effective motion and audio Generally, assist the creative team in creating assets for digital and traditional advertising campaigns Qualifications: 4+ years of motion design and video editing experience, preferably at an agency Demonstrated familiarity with current 2D motion design principles, trends, and best practices Ability to provide and receive feedback in a positive and constructive manner Strong organizational and time management skills and attention to detail Proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite (especially After Effects, Premiere Pro, Audition, Illustrator, and Photoshop) Familiarity with the post-production video workflow, including content sourcing, organization, editing, color correction, sound mixing, and delivery Experience working with both raw footage and stock Strong sense of timing, typography, and color Experience working independently or with a team on multiple competing tasks and demands in a fast-paced environment Experience designing advertising creative is a plus (but not a prerequisite), especially in progressive politics or advocacy Benefits:C+K offers a full benefits package that includes: medical insurance (Platinum-level reference plan is 100% paid by employer), options for dental and vision insurance, 401(k) with company contribution, short-term disability, flexible spending accounts, transportation benefits, paid time off, and paid holidays, among other benefits. C+K is an equal opportunity employer.Location:This position is remote within the continental United States, or in-office (including flex schedules between office/home) in Washington, DC (a small number of location exclusions apply). At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas and require non-temporary authorization to work in the US.Compensation:Compensation is commensurate with experience and skills, but our compensation assumption for this position is a base salary of $80k-89k with significant bonuses based on company and individual performance (averaging 1-3 months salary).How to Apply:Please send your r√©sum√©, cover letter, and a link to a portfolio/reel that includes 5-15 samples of your best work to artcareers@chongandkoster.com. Any additional non-video creative you would like to show us is also welcome.

title: Midweight Designer
description: Full time / Hybrid working (Studio 3 days per week)As a Midweight Designer you will be at the heart of our creative output. Creating work that drives projects forward, you will be relied upon to answer design briefs with creative solutions to a high standard. Working with and reporting to the Creative Director, but also across our entire team to ensure we meet our shared objectives.You‚Äôll have a love for creativity, bringing ideas, energy and solid design skills to any task; from immersion, to strategy, to expression and implementation. You‚Äôre ready for more: more responsibility, more experimentation, more of a challenge and more room to grow and develop.The successful candidate will be joining an ambitious, independent agency full of driven and passionate people. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, and this role will involve both internal and external collaboration.As Designer, you will have the ability to: Question and challenge briefs, and solve problems creatively Generate ideas and interesting creative work with strong conceptual foundations and strategies to exceed expectations and motivate others to do the same Provide valuable input across all stages of a project from immersion to implementation Take responsibility to hit deadlines, be aware of timings and being punctual while working efficiently on multiple projects Prepare and present work. Working directly with creative leads to build out proposals, pitches, and presentations Keep on top of your game, in a creative world that is always changing Present work to clients and explain, discuss, and justify design decisions and respond constructively and creatively to feedback Collaborative and excited to share ideas as well as work independently. Encourage an open and collaborative working culture Positive attitude, excited about creativity with a willingness to grow We‚Äôd like you to bring: 5+ years experience in a reputable agency environment, with experience of successful digital projects, working on pitch decks or print work that you can demonstrate through an online portfolio of work Your portfolio should reflect an exceptional foundation of design principles and how they translate into digital mediums Experience with UX deliverables such as user journeys, flows, sitemaps, wireframes and interactive prototypes. A strong focus on a user-centric approach. People are at the heart of everything we do. Designing for real people is what inspires us. A strong understanding of visual systems, interaction patterns, and established user behaviours. You know the rules and when to break them to better serve the user Able to work with users/clients to understand their needs, pain points and to identify opportunities for improvement A clear communicator. Capable of conveying ideas and breaking down concepts clearly to a diverse range of stakeholders (verbally and written) High standards for craft. Able to understand the importance of small details and believing that we don‚Äôt settle, we push for only the best creative work. An advanced proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as Figma, InVision and Adobe CS Experience in animation, motion theory a bonus As part of our team, you get: 28 days paid annual leave plus your birthday off Flexible and hybrid working options Health insurance for you and your immediate family Team events and celebrations ¬£1,000 annual training budget Apple laptop The interview Selected applicants will be invited for an interview. A task will be set and you will need to present your work to the team.

title: Digital Agency Designer
description: Were a strategy-led and mission-focused creative agency looking for a full-time designer to join our team.Hi there, heres a bit about the jobNiftic is looking a skilled Digital Designer to join our vibrant team of strategists, designers, and developers. We‚Äôre looking for a creative maverick who wholeheartedly embraces the transformative potential of extraordinary ideas and masterfully crafted brand and digital experiences.In this role, you‚Äôll play a crucial role in conceptualizing and bringing to life exceptional digital experiences. As a member, you‚Äôll work closely with Niftic‚Äôs creative director, spearheading various and diverse projects from inception to implementation. Collaborating closely with our cross-functional team, your experience will drive innovative, strategic, and visually stunning solutions.Is Niftic a perfect fit for you?At Niftic, our selection process is based on individual qualifications, merit, business needs, and alignment with our core values. Were deeply committed to making a positive impact by tackling the worlds most pressing challenges. Recent endeavors include partnering with organizations to safeguard forests, explore innovative carbon dioxide removal strategies in our oceans, and spearhead global transportation electrification. Working with Niftic means channeling your skills towards creating genuine change.Still curious? Check us out at www.niftic.com Role ResponsibilitiesYour role entails crafting unique brand experiences for web (occasionally venturing into print), leading and executing strategic digital project designs, and maintaining design quality throughout all project phases. Youll be an integral part of our creative team, working alongside brand designers, strategists, developers, and more. Other responsibilities for this role include: Work in tandem with Niftic‚Äôs creative director to steer the design process by generating innovative ideas, concepts, and visual designs for digital projects. Collaborate with clients & internal teams to understand project goals, user needs, and brand guidelines, and translate them into effective, engaging digital designs. Create wireframes, user flows, and prototypes to effectively communicate design concepts and interactions. Develop high-fidelity visual designs, incorporating user-centered design principles & best practices in UI/UX design. Ensure consistency and quality of design deliverables throughout the project lifecycle, from initial concepts to final implementation. Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and design tools, and share knowledge and insights with the team to drive innovation and foster a collaborative environment. Collaborate with developers to ensure accurate implementation of designs and maintain design integrity during the development phase. Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback to iterate and improve design solutions based on user needs and behaviors. Act as a design advocate, presenting and articulating design concepts, strategies, and solutions to teams and clients. QualificationsWe are looking for individuals with a keen interest in digital projects, interactive design, branding, and concept-led design. You should have a deep understanding of UX principles, a passion for graphic expression, and a curiosity to explore. Other key qualifications include: A diverse and strong portfolio showcasing your experience in designing a wide range of digital experiences. Expert proficiency in Figma, Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and other design tools is essential. Knowledge of After Effects, prototyping tools, PowerPoint, and Google Slides is a plus. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, information architecture, and interaction design. Experience in creating wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity visual designs that demonstrate a deep understanding of UI/UX best practices. Articulate and creative writing skills to communicate the story and strategy behind your designs. A team-oriented mindset and excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to present and articulate design concepts to teams and clients. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality designs within project timelines. Leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to guide and inspire junior designers. Experience working in an agile development environment and collaborating closely with developers. NOTE: International candidates must hold a valid US working permit. Compensation & BenefitsNiftic offers a variety of benefits, including: Full-time, remote role Competitive salary 100% health insurance premium coverage Healthcare concierge service Generous PTO and sick leave 401(k) plan with employer match Paid parental leave Health & wellness stipend Annual company retreat Apply for the jobJoin us at Niftic to apply your skills to solve global challenges and create an impact. Sound like a good fit? Then wed love to hear about you!

title: UI/UX Experienced Designer
description: Who We Are: SunRay Construction Solutions is an online construction documents service that specializes in Lien and Lien Waivers Management Services and Software. Our product and service will need to cater to various customers, from enterprises to small businesses, primarily targeting General Contractors, Subcontractors, and Suppliers in the Construction Industry across the US and Canada. What we are looking for: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including in-house designers, backend engineers, and stakeholders, to gather requirements and define user interface and user experience goals. Take our existing design prototypes and make changes to the overall design system to take it an enterprise level. Provide branding guide, wireframes, low and high-fidelity designs along with interactive animations wherever required. Review our existing design system and make necessary changes based on new designs provided by your company to ensure consistency across the product. Simultaneously provide design iterations for multiple modules inside the application to be sent for programming. Requirements: 9+ years with a proven track record of successfully delivering UI/UX design projects for SaaS or service software products. Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite and Figma pipeline. Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and practices. Excellent visual design skills with a keen eye for detail. Experience working in an agile development environment and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively articulate design concepts and decisions. Skills Required: Experience in designing for complex software systems or enterprise-level applications. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and front-end development principles to collaborate effectively with developers. Experience with usability testing and conducting user research.
